title: Spanish King Echoes Moon’s Vision for DMZ to Resemble Santiago Trail
text:
President Moon Jae-in said he hopes the demilitarized zone between the two Koreas will one day attract and welcome people from all over the world, like the Camino de Santiago walking trail in Spain.

Speaking at a bilateral summit with Spain's King Felipe VI at Cheong Wa Dae on Wednesday, Moon said, "When peace settles on the Korean Peninsula, I hope the demilitarized zone... can be connected as a 'road of peace' where citizens of the world can walk together. I also ask for Spain's steadfast support and cooperation in our efforts for peace," Moon said.

Moon was referring to his vision to transform the DMZ into a global peace zone, laid out in his UN General Assembly address last month.

The Spanish king said he would also like to see the DMZ become a symbol of world peace.

The two leaders discussed a wide range of areas for cooperation between the two countries, which celebrate 70 years of diplomatic relations next year. On Thursday, the leaders will attend a business forum, where they will further discuss ways to boost bilateral economic ties.
